meta.name: description
meta.content: The Cranbury School is a Pre-K to grade 8 elementary school with a total school population of 496 students, tucked away on Main Street in Cranbury, New Jersey. Our high school-aged children attend Princeton High School.

li.a: School Hours - Regular Day, Shortened Day, Early Dismissal

div.div: About Us
div.p: Learn about our history, operations, performance and vision for the future.

li.a: Purchasing: Requests for Proposal, Bids, Etc.

div.div: Board of Education
div.p: We are committed to transparency. This section features Board of Education information, including meeting schedules, budget and financial information and how to contact our elected representatives.

img.alt: Library desk with stacked and open book

div.div: Curriculum & Instruction
div.p: Our curriculum maps and resources can help you understand what we teach and the our plans for delivering differentiated, meaningful instruction in all areas of our curriculum.

div.div: Programs & Services
div.p: The Cranbury School District offers a variety of programs and services in order to create a comprehensive educational experience.

img.alt: Girls sitting in front of lockers

div.div: Student Life
div.p: This section features much of the “day-to-day”’ information our students and families need.

img.alt: Tiles on a scrabble board spelling out the words school, learn and math

div.div: Community
div.p: This section features information from and ways to connect with the organizations, officials and agencies who support the Cranbury School District.

div.div: Real-Time Communications, Educational Resources & Links, Wellness, and Remote Learning Plans may be accessed here.

img.alt: photo of people sitting in a circle with arms stretched out, holding hands.

h3.a: Cranbury School Student Virtual Spirit Week!

div.div: We're looking for our students to show their school spirit and Viking Pride!

h3.a: Need to register your student for school?

div.div: Although we are operating under remote learning conditions, if you need to register your student for school, we can help!

h3.a: JOIN TODAY ~ School News app by Edlio

div.div: New communications feature to share updates and news with our community! It's free to download from an iOS or Android phone!

h3.a: NJ DOE Releases 2018-2019 School Performance Report

div.div: The 2018-19 New Jersey School Performance Reports are available on the New Jersey School Performance Reports Web site at www.njschooldata.org.

img.alt: Man lathering his hands with soap.

h3.a: Middlesex County Office of Health Services - COVID-19 Information Update

div.div: Middlesex County health officials share an update with the community on March 16, 2020.

h3.a: Nurse's Corner: Prevention Strategies to Stop the Spread of COVID-19

div.div: Prevention is the best medicine!

h3.a: Cranbury School COVID-19 Update: Remote Learning as of March 16

div.div: Parent guidance presentation now available.

h3.a: Read Across America Week: A Nation of Diverse Readers

div.div: Students created flags for the K-4 Parade of Nations and designed Peace Doves during Buddy Classes to celebrate our nation's diversity.

img.alt: Person typing on laptop with stethescope laying nearby.

h3.a: What Every American & Community Can Do to Decrease the Spread of the Coronavirus

div.div: Strategies and resources you can apply at home, work, school, etc.
The Wellness & Sustainability Council has accomplished a great deal to promote wellness and sustainability initiatives in the school over the past year!

h3.a: Reflections on the Cranbury School Spelling Bee

div.div: Eighth grader Erin Carney, aspiring poet and spelling bee participant, reflects on the bee.
Dr. Genco's message to students...

img.alt: Compass with the word strategy inside and the Cranbury Viking Logo

div.div: The Cranbury School, the heart of our community, offers every student an opportunity to shine. We inspire each other to build lives of intellectual curiosity and purpose. While learning timeless skills, students develop character and confidence to lead by example in a diverse and changing world.
Cranbury School District

div.span: Dr. Susan L. Genco Superintendent/ Principal

li.a: Assistant Principal/ HIB Coordinator: Michele Waldron
School Business Administrator/ Affirmative Action Officer Nicole Petrone
